meanings.definition: To leave or give by will after one's death.
meanings.sent1: She bequeathed her favorite necklace to her granddaughter.
meanings.sent2: He bequeathed his entire estate to charity in his will.
meanings.sent3: The old man bequeathed his collection of stamps to the local museum.
meanings.sent4: The wise king bequeathed his kingdom to his eldest son.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was bequeathed to the museum for safekeeping.

meanings.sent1: The tradition of storytelling was bequeathed from generation to generation.
meanings.sent2: He bequeathed his knowledge of woodworking to his apprentice.
meanings.sent3: The recipe for the secret sauce was bequeathed to the new chef.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility of leadership was bequeathed to the next in line.
meanings.sent5: The ancient wisdom was bequeathed through the ages in the form of legends.
